comment: This is a rectangular block of Chinese text arranged in vertical columns, typical of traditional East Asian printing. The text includes both small regular script (likely explanatory text or definitions) and larger, stylized characters (possibly seal script or another classical form), likely from a dictionary or lexicon such as the *Shuowen Jiezi*. The layout features black borders around the text area, with annotations on the left margin indicating section headings or page numbers ('大卅', '兌文二十二', '十三', '唐文').
